SENT.plain: As part of an assessment for preeclampsia, a prenatal sonogram performed on a pregnant woman at 33 weeks 4 days' gestation showed ectrodactyly in all 4 fetal extremities
The woman's husband had a history of hand abnormalities but was unaware that his condition was genetic

His examination was notable for ectrodactyly, small, peg-shaped teeth, microretrognathia, nail dysplasia, and a history of lacrimal duct blockage in infancy, consistent with a diagnosis of acro-dermato-ungual-lacrimal-tooth (ADULT) syndrome
Acro-dermato-ungual-lacrimal-tooth syndrome is inherited as an autosomal dominant condition
Many of the inherited ectrodactyly syndromes are now known to be due to mutations in the p63 gene
This case, in which a prenatal sonographic diagnosis of ADULT syndrome was made, illustrates the importance of following up on a history of paternal hand anomalies
